dt: {bc}a gaseous, liquid, or solid foreign body enclosed in a mass (as of a mineral)
{bc}a passive usually temporary product of cell activity (such as a starch grain) within the cytoplasm or nucleus
{bc}the act or practice of including students with disabilities with the general student population

dt.t: {wi}Inclusion{/wi} refers to a variety of integration approaches, but the goal is to blend special education students into the traditional classroom.

dt: {bc}the act or practice of including and accommodating people who have historically been excluded (as because of their race, gender, sexuality, or ability)

dt.t: … academic libraries have traditionally struggled to address problems of equity, diversity and {wi}inclusion{/wi}. The low representation of people of color in library staff has been a particular shortcoming, despite many initiatives to attract minority staff to the field.
Tech workers say they are more interested in diversity and are more willing to work to promote {wi}inclusion{/wi} in their workplace …
Meaningful civic {wi}inclusion{/wi} even now eludes many of our fellow citizens who are recognizably of African descent.

dt: {bc}a relation between two classes {dx_def}see {dxt|class||3c}{/dx_def} that exists when all members of the first class are also members of the second {dx}compare {dxt|membership||3}{/dx}

shortdef: the act of including : the state of being included
something that is included: such as
a gaseous, liquid, or solid foreign body enclosed in a mass (as of a mineral)

dt: {bc}an inclusion, abnormal structure, or foreign cell within a cell (such as the eosinophilic body formed by a cytomegalovirus or the abnormal filament characteristic of some myopathies)

shortdef: an inclusion, abnormal structure, or foreign cell within a cell (such as the eosinophilic body formed by a cytomegalovirus or the abnormal filament characteristic of some myopathies)
